job.title: Distinguished Software Engineer
job.description: <strong><u>Position Summary... What You'll Do...<br><br></u></strong>Reduces customer impact (for example, sales loss) due to applications systems issues by ensuring high quality using quality standards; measuring<br><br>sales loss and performing root cause analysis; publishing results; and developing future prevention plan.<br><br>Develops and executes technical software development strategy for ecommerce applications and systems using current business roadmap by<br><br>analyzing competitive trends and patterns; analyzing the technology landscape; evaluating short and long term implications; and communicating<br><br>strategies and change initiatives clearly.<br><br>Drives continuous process improvement and innovation by identifying inefficiencies in current processes; improving agility of the team; and adopting<br><br>industry trends for innovation.<br><br>Ensures product quality by developing and executing quality assurance plan; using data and experience to determine customer needs; directing<br><br>continuous improvement and eliminating non-value-added work; measuring milestones for quality; and developing mitigation plans to ensure quality.<br><br>Executes engineering projects by developing resource planning for business roadmap in advance; removing barriers to success; ensuring others<br><br>have the information, training, resources, and implementation time needed to succeed; developing and upgrading work assignments and processes to<br><br>accomplish goals across functions, organizations, and geographies; reviewing project progress against timeline; and developing and communicating<br><br>logical, convincing justifications, including lessons learned, to build commitment and support.<br><br>Provides overall direction by analyzing business objectives and customer needs; developing, communicating, building support for, and implementing<br><br>business strategies, plans, and practices; analyzing costs and forecasts and incorporating them into business plans; determining and supporting<br><br>resource requirements; evaluating operational processes; measuring outcomes to ensure desired results; identifying and capitalizing on improvement<br><br>opportunities; promoting a customer environment; and demonstrating adaptability and sponsoring continuous learning.<br><br>Develops and implements strategies to attract and maintain a highly skilled and engaged workforce by diagnosing capability gaps; recruiting,<br><br>selecting, and developing talent; supporting mentorship, workforce development, and succession planning; and leveraging the capabilities of new and<br><br>existing talent.<br><br>Cultivates an environment where associates respect and adhere to company standards of integrity and ethics by integrating these values into all<br><br>programs and practices; developing consequences for violations or non-compliance; and supporting the Open Door Policy.<br><br>Develops and leverages internal and external partnerships and networks to maximize the achievement of business goals by sponsoring and leading<br><br>key community outreach and involvement initiatives; engaging key stakeholders in the development, execution, and evaluation of appropriate<br><br>business plans and initiatives; and supporting associate efforts in these areas.<br><br><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications...<br><br></u></strong><em><em>Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications. <br><br></em></em>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and 7 years’ experience in software engineering or related field OR 9 years’ experience in software engineering or related field. Preferred Qualifications...<br><br><em><em>Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications. <br><br></em></em>Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field and 6 years' experience in software engineering Primary Location...2628 NE UNIVERSITY VILLAGE ST, SEATTLE, WA 98105-5023, United States of America
